item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "History will be kind to me for I intend to write it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "Writing is a way of talking without being interrupted." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "When I write, I feel like an armless, legless man with a crayon in his mouth." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The most valuable of all talents is that of never using two words when one will do." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Don Roff
item.description: "Nothing's a better cure for writer's block than to eat ice cream right out of the carton." -- Don Roff

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "There's no such thing as perfect writing, just like there's no such thing as perfect despair." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Isadora Duncan
item.description: "It has taken me years of struggle, hard work, and research to learn to make one simple gesture, and I know enough about the art of writing to realize that it would take as many years of concentrated effort to write one simple, beautiful sentence." -- Isadora Duncan

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Thomas Mann
item.description: "A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people." -- Thomas Mann

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "A word after a word after a word is power." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "How do I know what I think until I see what I say?" -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "...there would be punishment and pain, and there would be happiness, too. That was writing." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Red Smith
item.description: "There's nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and open a vein." -- Red Smith

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Phyllis A. Whitney
item.description: "A good book isn't written, it's rewritten." -- Phyllis A. Whitney

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "I think no more than a week after I started writing I ran into the first block. It's hard to describe it in a way that will be understandable to anyone who is not a neurotic. I will try. All my life I have been haunted by the obsession that to desire a thing or to love a thing intensely is to place yourself in a vulnerable position, to be a possible, if not a probable, loser of what you most want. Let's leave it like that. That block has always been there and always will be, and my chance of getting, or achieving, anything that I long for will always be gravely reduced by the interminable existence of that block." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Charles Caleb Colton
item.description: "Our admiration of fine writing will always be in proportion to its real difficulty and its apparent ease." -- Charles Caleb Colton

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Richard Rodriguez
item.description: "The drama of the essay is the way the public life intersects with my personal and private life. It's in that intersection that I find the energy of the essay." -- Richard Rodriguez

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "There is no real ending. Itâ€™s just the place where you stop the story." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "I confess to wincing every so often at a poorly chosen word, a mangled sentence, an expression of emotion that seems indulgent or overly practiced. I have the urge to cut the book by fifty pages or so, possessed as I am with a keener appreciation for brevity." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Writing in English is the most ingenious torture ever devised for sins committed in previous lives. The English reading public explains the reason why." -- James Joyce

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Drew Goodman
item.description: "Writing- the profession in which you stare at a computer screen, stare out the window, type a few words, then curse repeatedly." -- Drew Goodman

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The scariest moment is always just before you start." -- Stephen King

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Nora Roberts
item.description: "You can't edit a blank page" -- Nora Roberts

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Robert Cormier
item.description: "The beautiful part of writing is that you don't have to get it right the first time, unlike, say, a brain surgeon." -- Robert Cormier

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Aaron Sorkin
item.description: "I love writing, but hate starting. The page is awfully white and it says, 'You may have fooled some of the people some of the time but those days are over, Giftless. I'm not your agent and I'm not your mommy: I'm a white piece of paper. You wanna dance with me?' and I really, really don't. I'll go peaceable-like." -- Aaron Sorkin

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I just sit at my typewriter and curse a bit." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Write with the door closed, rewrite with the door open." -- Stephen King

item.title: Cynthia add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Some editors are failed writers, but so are most writers." -- T.S. Eliot
